bank:
PDE16 - Brain Dump (google.passguide.professional-data-engineer.sample.question.2023-may-06.by.osmond.154q.vce)
Your company is loading comma-separated values (CSV) files into Google BigQuery. The data is fully imported successfully; however, the imported data is not matching byte-to-byte to the source file. What is the most likely cause of this problem?
false The CSV data loaded in BigQuery is not flagged as CSV.
false The CSV data has invalid rows that were skipped on import.
false The CSV data loaded in BigQuery is not using BigQueryâ€™s default encoding.
false The CSV data has not gone through an ETL phase before loading into BigQuery.
Answer: B
Which of the following is NOT a valid use case to select HDD (hard disk drives) as the storage for Google Cloud Bigtable?
false You expect to store at least 10 TB of data.
false You will mostly run batch workloads with scans and writes, rather than frequently executing random reads of a small number of rows.
false You need to integrate with Google BigQuery.
false You will not use the data to back a user-facing or latency-sensitive application.
Answer: C
